org.apache.ddlutils.io
Class PrettyPrintingXmlWriter

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.ddlutils.io.PrettyPrintingXmlWriter
Direct Known Subclasses:
DataWriter
public class PrettyPrintingXmlWriter
extends Object

Helper class that writes XML data with or without pretty printing.

Version:
$Revision: $

                        throws DdlUtilsXMLException

Throws:
DdlUtilsXMLException

public PrettyPrintingXmlWriter(OutputStream output,
                               String encoding)
                        throws DdlUtilsXMLException
Creates a xml writer instance.

Parameters:
output - The target to write the data XML to
encoding - The encoding of the XML file
Throws:
DdlUtilsXMLException

PrettyPrintingXmlWriter

public PrettyPrintingXmlWriter(Writer output,
                               String encoding)
                        throws DdlUtilsXMLException
Creates a xml writer instance using the specified writer. Note that the writer needs to be configured using the specified encoding.

Parameters:
output - The target to write the data XML to
encoding - The encoding of the writer
Throws:
DdlUtilsXMLException

                       throws DdlUtilsXMLException

Parameters:
baseEx - The original exception
Throws:
DdlUtilsXMLException - The wrapped exception

isPrettyPrinting

public boolean isPrettyPrinting()
Determines whether the output shall be pretty-printed.

Returns:
true if the output is pretty-printed

Specifies whether the output shall be pretty-printed.

Parameters:
prettyPrinting - true if the output is pretty-printed

writeDocumentStart

public void writeDocumentStart()
                        throws DdlUtilsXMLException
Writes the start of the XML document, i.e. the "" section and the start of the root node.

DdlUtilsXMLException

                      throws DdlUtilsXMLException

DdlUtilsXMLException

writeNamespace

public void writeNamespace(String prefix,
                           String namespaceUri)
                    throws DdlUtilsXMLException
Writes a xmlns attribute to the stream.

Parameters:
prefix - The prefix for the namespace, use null or an empty string for the default namespace
namespaceUri - The namespace uri, can be null
Throws:
DdlUtilsXMLException

writeElementStart

public void writeElementStart(String namespaceUri,
                              String localPart)
                       throws DdlUtilsXMLException
Writes the start of the indicated XML element.

Parameters:
namespaceUri - The namespace uri, can be null
localPart - The local part of the element's qname
Throws:
DdlUtilsXMLException

writeElementEnd

                     throws DdlUtilsXMLException
Writes the end of the current XML element.

Throws:
DdlUtilsXMLException

writeAttribute

public void writeAttribute(String namespaceUri,
                           String localPart,
                           String value)
                    throws DdlUtilsXMLException
Writes an XML attribute.

Parameters:
namespaceUri - The namespace uri, can be null
localPart - The local part of the attribute's qname
value - The value; if null then no attribute is written
Throws:
DdlUtilsXMLException
